member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.BarCode.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder that contains the Aspose component assembly.
3. The folder that contains the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder that contains the entry (startup) assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic") Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.BarCode.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.License.IsLicensed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether product is licensed.
member.value: true if product is licensed; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint
member.summary: Manual hints.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.None
member.summary: There are no heavy recognition algorithms. The fastest recognition algorithms are used there, however if image is noisy recognition will fail. Used by default.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.InvertImage
member.summary: Use when image is white on black background. Typically BarCode images are black on white background.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.IncorrectBarcodes
member.summary: Addition algorithms are included to recognize incorrectly generated or damaged barcodes (skipped bars, stop symbol, etc). May return deniable recognition.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCodeRecognition.ManualHint.ComplexBackground
member.summary: Analyzes barcode background. Useful with complex or colored backgrounds.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCodeRecognition.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: The Aspose.BarCodeRecognition contains tools for the 1D/2D barcodes recognition.

summary.para: Enable checksum validation during recognition for 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbologies which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum never used: Codabar
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN
Checksum always used: Rest symbologies

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCodeRecognition.ChecksumValidation.Default
member.summary: If checksum is required by the specification - it will be validated.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCodeRecognition.ChecksumValidation.On
member.summary: Always validate checksum if possible.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCodeRecognition.ChecksumValidation.Off
member.summary: Do not validate checksum.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode
member.summary: Recognition modes.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.MaxPerformance
member.summary: Finds all the possible good and average quality barcodes. Uses only the fastest algorithms. Enabled by default.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.MaxQuality
member.summary: Finds all the possible barcodes with good or bad quality. Doesn't return potential barcodes. Uses different fast and slow algorithms.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.MaxBarCodes
member.summary: Extends MaxQuality. Finds even potential barcodes. Uses extra algorithms which may recognize incorrect barcodes, barcodes on complex background, noisy or damaged barcodes and etc. You may observe extra spurious barcodes.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCodeRecognition.RecognitionMode.ManualHints
member.summary: User configures hints optionally. Allows you to adjust the balance between speed and quality manually.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.EnableEscape
member.summary: Indicates whether explains the character "\" as an escape character in CodeText property. See . If the EnableEscape is true, "\" will be explained as a special escape character. Otherwise, "\" acts as normal characters.Aspose.BarCode supports inputing decimal ascii code and mnemonic for ASCII control-code characters, 0 through 31. For example, \013 and \CR stands for CR.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.yDimension
member.summary:
y-dimension, smallest height unit of 2D BarCode's modules. Some square symbols (such as DataMatrix) may ignore this and use x-dimension for both width unit and height unit
In 2D barcode, y-dimension * rows determines BarCode's height In 1D barcode, BarHeight determines BarCode's height. Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter See . See .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.BarHeight
member.summary: height of 1D barcodes' bars. In 2D barcode, y-dimension * rows determines BarCode's height In 1D barcode, BarHeight determines BarCode's height. Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter See .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.AspectRatio
member.summary: 2D BarCode's module's height/width ratio (yDimension/xDimension). calculated based on xDimension set to 0 means not using this feature. See . See .
member.remarks: Some 2D BarCodes are square shaped, then AspectRatio is not appliable

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.Margins
member.summary: Margin area around the core BarCode image If AutoSize is false, then Width and Height is fixed, thus Margins setting will be ignored Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.SupplementSpace
member.summary: Space between main the BarCode and supplement BarCode, default Graphics Unit: millimeter See . See .

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.PostnetShortBarHeight
member.summary: Short bar's height of Postnet barcode, it has to be between 1 millimeter and 1.5 milimeter (0.04 inch and 0.06 inch). To set up tall bar's height, see BarHeight, which has to be between 8.28 milimeter and 9.72 milimeter (0.115 inch and 0.135 inch) see changing See GraphicsUnit. see setting tall bar's height: See BarHeight.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.PlanetShortBarHeight
member.summary: Short bar's height of Planet barcode, it has to be between 1 millimeter and 1.5 milimeters. see changing See GraphicsUnit. see setting tall bar's height: See BarHeight.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.BarCodeBuilder.ThrowExceptionWhenCodeTextIncorrect
member.summary: Only for 1D barcodes. If codetext is incorrect and value set to true - exception will be thrown. Overwise codetext will be corrected to match barcode's specification. Exception always will be thrown for: Databar symbologies if codetext is incorrect. Exception always will not be thrown for: AustraliaPost, SingapurePost, Code39Extended, Code93Extended, Code16K, Code128 symbologies if codetext is incorrect.

member.summary: Encode codetext with UTF8 encoding with first ByteOfMark character.

member.summary: Encode codetext with UTF8 encoding with first ByteOfMark character. It can be problems with some barcode scaners.

member.summary: Encode codetext with value set in the ECIEncoding property. It can be problems with some old (pre 2006) barcode scaners.

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeMode.ExtendedCodetext

summary.para: Extended Channel mode which supports FNC1 first position, FNC1 second position and multi ECI modes.
It is better to use QrExtCodetextBuilder for extended codetext generation.
Use Display2DText property to set visible text to removing managing characters.
Encoding Principles:
All symbols "\" must be doubled "\\" in the codetext.
FNC1 in first position is set in codetext as as "<FNC1>"
FNC1 in second position is set in codetext as as "<FNC1(value)>". The value must be single symbols (a-z, A-Z) or digits from 0 to 99.
Group Separator for FNC1 modes is set as 0x1D character '\u001D'
If you need to insert "<FNC1>" string into barcode write it as "<\FNC1>"
ECI identifiers are set as single slash and six digits identifier "\000026" - UTF8 ECI identifier
TO disable current ECI mode and convert to default JIS8 mode zero mode ECI indetifier is set. "\000000"
All unicode characters after ECI identifier are automatically encoded into correct character codeset.

member.name: T:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeType
member.summary: QR / MicroQR selector mode. Select ForceQR for standard QR symbols, Auto for MicroQR. ForceMicroQR is used for strongly MicroQR symbol generation if it is possible.

member.summary: Mode starts barcode version negotiation from MicroQR V1

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeType.ForceQR
member.summary: Mode starts barcode version negotiation from QR V1

member.name: F:Aspose.BarCode.QREncodeType.ForceMicroQR
member.summary: Mode starts barcode version negotiation from from MicroQR V1 to V4. If data cannot be encoded into MicroQR, exception is thrown.

y-dimension, smallest height unit of 2D BarCode's modules. Some square symbols (such as DataMatrix) may ignore this and use x-dimension for both width unit and height unit
In 2D barcode, y-dimension * rows determines BarCode's height In 1D barcode, BarHeight determines BarCode's height. Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter see . see .

summary.para: Enable checksum during generation for 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbologies which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum never used: Codabar
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN
Checksum always used: Rest symbologies

member.summary: BarCode Windows Control, goto your toolbox panel and add BarCode.dll, and you will see BarCodeControl appears. Just drag it and drop to your windows form see see supported symbology: 1D: Codabar, Code11, Code128, Code39Standard, Code39Extended Code93Standard, Code93Extended, EAN13, EAN8, Interleaved2of5, MSI, Standard2of5, UPCA, UPCE, ISBN, GS1Code128, Postnet, Planet EAN14, SCC14, SSCC18, ITF14, SingaporePost 2D: DataMatrix, PDf417, QR code

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Windows.Forms.BarCodeControl.EnableEscape
member.summary: Indicates whether explains the character "\" as an escape character in CodeText property. see If the EnableEscape is true, "\" will be explained as a special escape character. Otherwise, "\" acts as normal characters.Aspose.BarCode supports inputing decimal ascii code and mnemonic for ASCII control-code characters, 0 through 31. For example, \013 and \CR stands for CR.

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Windows.Forms.BarCodeControl.yDimension
member.summary:
y-dimension, smallest height unit of 2D BarCode's modules. Some square symbols (such as DataMatrix) may ignore this and use x-dimension for both width unit and height unit
In 2D barcode, y-dimension * rows determines BarCode's height In 1D barcode, BarHeight determines BarCode's height. Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter see see

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Windows.Forms.BarCodeControl.BarHeight
member.summary: height of 1D barcodes' bars. In 2D barcode, y-dimension * rows determines BarCode's height In 1D barcode, BarHeight determines BarCode's height. Default Graphics Unit: Millimeter see

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Windows.Forms.BarCodeControl.ForeColor
member.summary: Foreground color of the barcode image, that is, Bar's color of 1D barcode, Module's color of 2D barcode see

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Windows.Forms.BarCodeControl.BackColor
member.summary: Background color of the barcode image see

summary.para: Enable checksum during generation for 1D barcodes.
Default is treated as Yes for symbologies which must contain checksum, as No where checksum only possible.
Checksum never used: Codabar
Checksum is possible: Code39 Standard/Extended, Standard2of5, Interleaved2of5, Matrix2of5, ItalianPost25, DeutschePostIdentcode, DeutschePostLeitcode, VIN
Checksum always used: Rest symbologies

member.name: P:Aspose.BarCode.Windows.Forms.BarCodeControl.AspectRatio
member.summary: 2D BarCode's module's height/width ratio (yDimension/xDimension). calculated based on xDimension set to 0 means not using this feature. see see
member.remarks: Some 2D BarCodes are square shaped, then AspectRatio is not appliable
